answers.answer: Hi.  I'm not a medical expert, just the parent of a kid with diabetes.  I've heard of cases like yours, but don't know much about it because they are few and far between.  Guess you get to be one of the "lucky" ones.If I had a suggestion, it would be to work hardest to control the diabetes which is controllable by you.  That would be the type 2.  Exercise and watch what you eat, that would have the potential for eliminating the type 2 portion of your type 3, or at least mitigating the effects.  The diet and exercise change would also affect the type 1 side, as it would lower your insulin needs, make your body more sensitive instead of less sensitive to insulin, and it would help your mental outlook simply by being healthier.Other than that, just continue to work with your doctor and monitor your blood sugars.
